contentrichtext.text: {{CIA}} {{Infobox islands | name = [[Mauritius]] | image name = Mauritius island location.svg | image caption = Location of Mauritius | image size = | locator map = Mauritius Island map-fr.svg | native name = ''Maurice'' | native name link = Mauritian Creole | nickname = ''The Star and Key of the Indian Ocean'' | location = [[Indian Ocean]] | coordinates = {{coord|20|17|S|57|33|E|display=inline}} | archipelago = [[Mascarene Islands]] | total islands = | major islands = | area_km2 = 2030 | length_km = | width_km = | highest mount = [[Piton de la Petite Rivière Noire]] | elevation_m = 828 | country = Mauritius | country admin divisions title = | country admin divisions = | country admin divisions title 1 = | country admin divisions 1 = | country admin divisions title 2 = | country admin divisions 2 = | country largest city = [[Port Louis]] | country largest city population = 147,688 | population = 1,264,866 | population as of = 2007 | density_km2 = 616 | ethnic groups = [[Indo-Mauritian]] 68%, [[Mauritian Creole people]] 27%, [[Sino-Mauritian]] 3%, [[Franco-Mauritian]] 2% | additional info = }} '''Mauritius''' is an island located in the [[Indian Ocean]], east of [[Madagascar]]. == Climate == The local [[climate]] is tropical, modified by southeast trade winds; there is a warm, dry winter from May to November and a hot, wet, and humid summer from November to May. [[Anti-cyclone]]s affect the country during May to September. [[Cyclones]] affect the country during November–April. [[Cyclone Hollanda|Hollanda]] (1994) and [[2001–02 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season|Dina]] (2002) were the worst two last cyclones to have affected the island. == Statistics == [[File:Mauritius OnEarth WMS.jpg|thumb|left|165px|Satellite image of Mauritius]] '''Location:''' Southern [[Africa]], island in the [[Indian Ocean]], east of [[Madagascar]] '''[[Geographic coordinates]]:''' {{coord|20|17|S|57|33|E|type:country}} '''Map references:''' World '''Area (includes [[Agaléga]], [[Cargados Carajos]] (Saint Brandon), and [[Rodrigues]]):''' <br>''total:'' 2,040 km² <br>''land:'' 2,030 km² <br>''water:'' 10 km² '''Land boundaries:''' 0 km '''Coastline:''' 177 km '''Maritime claims:''' <br>''continental shelf:'' {{convert|200|nmi|km mi|1|abbr=on|lk=in}} or to the edge of the [[continental margin]] <br>''exclusive economic zone:'' {{convert|200|nmi|km mi|1|abbr=on}} <br>''territorial sea:'' {{convert|12|nmi|km mi|1|abbr=on}} '''Terrain:''' small coastal plain rising to discontinuous mountains encircling central plateau '''Elevation extremes:''' <br>''lowest point:'' Indian Ocean 0 m <br>''highest point:'' [[Piton de la Petite Rivière Noire]] 828 m '''Natural resources:''' arable land, fish '''Land use:''' <br>''arable land:'' 49.26% <br>''permanent crops:'' 2.96% <br>''permanent pastures:'' 3% <br>''forests and woodland:'' 22% <br>''other:'' 23% (1993 est.) '''Irrigated land:''' 200 km² (1998 est.) '''Natural hazards:''' cyclones (November to April); almost completely surrounded by reefs that may pose maritime hazards '''Environment - current issues:''' water pollution, degradation of coral reefs '''Environment - international agreements:''' <br>''party to:'' Biodiversity, Climate Change, Climate Change-Kyoto Protocol, Desertification, Endangered Species, Environmental Modification, Hazardous Wastes, Law of the Sea, Marine Life Conservation, Nuclear Test Ban, Ozone Layer Protection, Ship Pollution, Wetlands <br>''signed, but not ratified:'' none of the selected agreements '''Geography - note:''' The main island, from which the country derives its name, is of volcanic origin and is almost entirely surrounded by coral reefs {{wide image|2007-09-09 Mauritius 24.jpg|900px|<center>Landscape near Les Mariannes.</center>}} == Extreme points == This is a list of the extreme points of [[Mauritius]], the points that are farther north, south, east or west than any other location. * Northernmost point – [[Tappe à Terre]], [[North Island, Agalega Islands|North Island]], [[Agalega Islands]] * Easternmost point – [[Trou d’Argent]], [[Rodrigues Island]] * Southernmost point - [[Le Gris Gris]], [[Savanne District]], Mauritius * Westernmost point - [[North West Point]], [[North Island, Agalega Islands|North Island]], [[Agalega Islands]] == See also == * [[Mauritius]] * [http://www.island-of-mauritius.com/en/geography-of-mauritius.html Mauritius Travel Information] (English) {{Navboxes |list = {{Mauritius topics}} {{Geography of Africa}} {{Africa topic|Climate of}} }} {{commons category|Geography of Mauritius}} <!--Categories--> [[Category:Geography of Mauritius| ]]
